Description: The Hearst Corporation and its parent, The Hearst Trust, agreed to pay $4 million to settle charges that the company failed to produce key documents before undertaking an acquisition subject to pre-merger review.

The Federal Trade Commission announced a settlement with Hearst Corporation resolving allegations that Hearst unlawfully acquired J.B. Laughery, Inc., which included the Medi-Span integratable drug information database business. Under the terms of the settlement, Hearst agreed to divest the former Medi-Span business and pay $19 million as disgorgement of unlawful profits.

The Hearst Trust and its wholly owned subsidiary, The Hearst Corporation, agreed to settle charges that it failed to include required documents in its premerger notification report concerning its 1998 acquisition of Medi-Span, Inc. and Medi-Span International, Inc.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
